VB2FbK8dq9Poz-ZPGXgmeg.review_text: Origin is a pretty nice place to go in San Francisco.  It's new, has a good sound system, and it seems a little more spacious compared to other SF clubs and lounges.  It looks hip, as the bar is nicely decorated with ambiance lights, while the stage nicely flashes with LED lights as it's sink'd with the rhythm. I like the set up, and the ambiance of the place. There is a second level with a bar and tables for table service, and the entrance area also consist of a bar with a small seating area with nice couches and table service.  The bad part is the ratio is really bad.  I believe there's probably seven guys for every one gal.  OMG.  So, if you're a gal seeking attention, and want to meet a ton of guys with testosterone raging, then you have come to the right place.  If you're a girl, you will feel on top of the world here... regardless of your size and physique.    The music started off a bit slow in the beginning.  It was hip hop and lounge music... which is fine.  Then the EDM stuff starts off at around midnight just when everybody is drunk.  The good thing good about Origin is the music stops at 2am, compared to other places that stops at 1:30am.  As usual, you will see a bunch of knuckle heads, and angry drunks as the night progresses. Boys will be boys pretending to be on top of the world, and girls pretending to be beauty queens will seek all the attention they can get.   What a comic strip!   Anyhow, the bartenders are nice along with the cocktail waitresses.  I usually tip according to their professionalism.  Yup, I guess I must have tipped quite a bit that night. Yes, I was light headed too.  The shots are about $10-12 each, and the cocktails is around $14.  Yes, some of the security guards have power trips.  But I learn to just ignore them and do whatever they say with a smile. They'll see that you're a nicer person and maybe you'll get in quicker.  No guest list necessary!  I feel for them and their jobs because of all the knuckle heads.  Origin is a nice place.  I don't mind checking it out again. Be cool, and be yourself to make the experience more enjoyable.

cqKMpi-j32YJ-bvBsbjJVw.review_text: So my friends and I got table service here this past weekend and we spent ~$700 on bottles. When we got our receipt, it showed a total of ~$1300...so of course we asked for the itemized receipt. Turns out they switched our silver patron bottle with some other fancier patron. We had to argue for awhile before they went back and checked our table for what we actually ordered. Not sure if this was an intentional mix up to trick drunk patrons or if it was an honest $600 mistake...but either way it seems pretty irresponsible and unacceptable to me. Especially with the hard time they were giving us about getting an itemized receipt, and then arguing with us about what we ordered.  I guess the take away is to make sure if you get table service, that even in your drunk state, be careful what you sign at the end of the night because mistakes do happen.

EolFJIil4F70YkpeW5VNfQ.review_text: I love this place, I really do. Unfortunately, this is like that one girlfriend you have that all your friends just hate. They just don't understand you like I do, Origin. You're something special, and I'll keep loving you no matter what.   Origin is half lounge, half dance club, and 100% asian paradise. This is my weekend mecca, where I drag my friends to the line at 10:00 to get through free at 10:30 just so I can fist pump to some EDM. The first half of the club has some nice couches, and a fireplace where people can chill. The next half of the club is a big dance floor, with a second level for more table service. The bartenders are pretty awesome too, always hooking it up with strong drinks and are super quick getting the drinks out. I don't necessarily remember paying more for drinks here than other clubs in SF.   I'm really not sure why people don't like this place, I think it's because of the wanna-be Vegas vibe that it gives off. My only complaints are that the place is become too popular, which means that I have to wait longer in line to get in, and that because it's getting more popular, it attracts more and more guys. Whatever, I still have fun.

EcNS3VUpK_PcO0vpz5P0_A.review_text: Origin never fails! I adore this place! Even though it may be considered small, It's still at the top of my list. The interior is very classy and cozy! Also, I love the fact that we have a plethora of couches to sit on, even if we don't have bottle service. The fireplace also adds a nice elegant touch to the whole place. Now, onto my favorite part -the music! I'm here for the music and to dance and Origin, in my opinion, plays the kind of stuff that I want to groove to. It's a mix of edm and hip hop, which are two of my favorite genres! And what makes this place even better is getting in for free with being on the guest list! It can't get any better than this =)

6creXKXZFVAV8abDvuz3Qw.review_text: I go clubbing in Sacramento too much and I came to SF looking to have a good time with old friends, and I was very disappointing with my experience at Origin.  I had high expectations for this place, but it's pretty mediocre. First off, the crowd is not diverse whatsoever, it's literally ALL ASIANS, most of them being FOBs to no disrespect. The crowd just sucks. I got there at 10 which is pretty early, but the guest list closes a 1030, so I didn't want to have to pay for this club and I'm glad I didn't. There was nobody here at 10pm on a Friday, the weekend after finals. I'e girld thought I'd allow this place some time to fill up a little bit, but people didn't start getting here till midnight, and same goes to the dance floor,  no one starting dancing till 12.  The girls. They don't dance. They just like stay in their group of 3-5 and just bob up and down. Girls here are super lame. I was talking to this girl for like 30 min, she was feelin me, I asked her to dance. She said she didn't know how to dance, #dealbreaker, and to my credit although I was drunk I didn't see her on the dance floor for the night (update for my fans)  The venue. Compared to most clubs, this place is pretty small. You walk in, there's a small lounge area with couches, then a hallway with the bathrooms that leads to the dance floor. It's a simple setup, but it's just too small for me. There's a upstairs overlooking the dance floor that is small and has booths only, for the chumps that wanna waste their money on that. There's a small outside area where you can smoke which is the same area of the guest list line there may not even be space.  The music, was actually super poppin. They had a mix of EDM as well hip hop, both the DJs were really great. If it weren't for the crowd, I would possibly come here all the time. For example, that "i'm in love with the coco" song, he just played that part of the song because the rest of it is bad. And then he transitioned to some EDM.   2/5, #notgoodenoughtocomeback

ltb_FEBEf2-PuPqQQ4aSHg.review_text: Really nice club layout, really fast bartenders, really aware security, really nice bathroom lighting.  Really crap music.  If you love dancing to Krewella all night, come here.

x1paA3aUHJTurbtFkBSOGg.review_text: Long, ridiculous line but the interior is really modern and nice. I can't wait until it becomes any other club in the city and it won't be hard to get in and be enjoyable because it has so much potential. Half lounge/ half club. Cheers to the owner for a great idea.

JZrsMlE3biNrsjTPXkPimw.review_text: So this is the new thing in SF... ok so I haven't gone to the club in a while and was expecting something better.  Got here on 10/18/14 for my friend's bday. This venue may look pretty nice as you walk in but damn it is pretty small on the dance floor.  $20 to get in after 10:30? hmmm I def don't think this was worth it.    I liked that there was a lot of seatings at the front next to the brightly lit bar.   We walked with the crowd down this small hallway that led us to the dance floor.  OMG it was like crazy packed... like I would get shoved because people were trying to get to the other side.  Maybe it's been a while since I've been to the club but I thought there should be more moving room.  There was also a big bar area on the left of the dance area so that is nice to not have to go to the front again.    I was able to just walk upstairs, I guess it wasn't just VIP?  Or they just dont care, but that was a breather, not having as many people upstairs.  Got boring, went back down.  There's just too many guys at this club. I mean that would be great if you are looking for one.  I was able to dance on top of a box next to the dj, woulda been cool if they got more of these, although, keep in mind, you shouldn't go up if you are drunk as hell. This girl fell right next to me.  Likes: -Pretty - lots of seats (although I hardly sat) - nice brightly lit bathroom with lots of mirrors  Dislikes: - Pricey - Too crowded - Too many guys - Dj/song sucked..idk what he was playing but I heard the same song like 3 times...-_- really now, you're out of songs already?  It was an experience...just to say I went there but I wouldn't go back.

N9gcGZI9bxNHj9UIrZUeMQ.review_text: Came here for NYE, entered around 11pm, no lines. Price was $15 because we bought early.  Music: I don't usually listen to hip hop/edm but that's 100% of the stuff they play here. I looked at other reviews where they said they played 100% EDM after midnight but that was not true. Perhaps it was NYE's DJ, but he was great, he mixed hip hop and EDM non stop. This was one of the best club nights I've had where every song was good. And I was sober btw.  Coat check: $5? Come on, that's just mean, but still, supply and demand baby.  Decor/Size: The entire dance floor was a little small for NYE, but that's expected, I'm sure it wouldn't be so crowded on a normal night. The 2nd floor area seems to be a hangout area as there isn't really much room to dance. Caution: The glass+metal frame fence seems sketchy, don't twerk on it ladies.  Crowd: If you don't like Asians or you'd prefer a club filled with caucasians and blacks, you've come to the wrong neighborhood. But for my NYE expereince, it was about 20% caucasian with maybe 5% black/indian/middle eastern  The floor: This is why I'm rating this place 3 stars. While dancing on the 2nd floor I noticed parts of the floor were made of this bubbly and shiny white surface. and what do you know? It's slippery, like REALLY slippery. I didn't fall, but I slipped and almost did. I did see another person fall though. If you look at the club's entrance to the dance floor, you'll see it is covered with floor mats. Why? Because under it is the same material. The club knows this is a problem but has not yet put out the money to fix the problem. I really wanted to give this place 2 stars to grab their attention but because everything else was great, here's 3 stars.  Drink prices: $14 for patron shots, that is all I got that night

8nZ3Ku4yC5HJxY_m0WFsGQ.review_text: I went here last night (Sat, 10/18) and I must admit that I had low expectations. San Francisco clubbing generally disappoints me - Booty SF, The Grand, etc. I got there around 10pm and there was already a HUGE long line stretching around the side of the building. Sorry, are we at XS or Hakkasan in Vegas?? Nope, actually we are in the Fillmore on a semi sketch block...anyway....  Luckily our group had a table so we only waited outside about 30 minutes before getting in without cover. I'm not sure if this place is worth it for a $20 cover as I believe girls have to pay that in addition to guys. The guest list gets in free before 10:30 but that means you probably need to be in line at least by 9:30. My backup plan for the evening was to go to 1300 Fillmore just down the block for some cocktails.  Once I got inside I was pleasantly surprised - the interior is really nice and trendy and more reminiscent of something you'd see in Vegas versus anything in SF. There are A LOT of tables in here both on the upper and lower floor. Despite the huge line outside the inside wasn't that crowded minus the dance floor. The DJ was ok, nothing special...not sure if they have better DJs on other days.   Overall, this was definitely one of the classier groups of people I've seen in SF. All the girls were dressed up nice in clubbing dresses; I saw very few people dressed inappropriately. And then there was a sea of guys in light blue button up shirts. I think they enforce some sort of a dress code so no sneakers or hoodies allowed.   And, oh yeah, this is definitely an Asian club so if you aren't Asian under age 28 or with Asians you'll probably feel just a tad out of place.

txrANKGe5_pxA9vw4XqyTA.review_text: Same owners as "The (not so) Grand", what else would you expect?  Went on opening night at 10pm (big mistake) and the line was literally around the corner.  What made it worse was that they weren't even letting people in so everyone would have to pay cover.    We ended up waiting an HOUR in line just to get to the very front and be the first ones to be DENIED.  They said they hit capacity and told my group and the 100+ people behind me to go to "The (not so) Grand".    Final Word:     Same owners, same shit

ZZlylZYQK2YgkugH42ieOQ.review_text: Venue is nice, atmosphere and overall aesthetic is pleasing. That's basically all it has going for it. They hold up the line so if you're trying to do guestlist, before 10pm is a good time to come because the line moves slowly. $20 after 10:30pm. The dancefloor was small and hardly contained any dancing. The ratio wasn't bad but the crowd was just awful. As a fellow asian, this place was 95% asian and you know what we're really good at? Pushing and shoving. I had an awkward time, the DJ music selection was pretty poor, he just played Top 40 which doesn't always translate to dance-able music. No, playing the theme song to fresh prince of bel air was not a good idea. After midnight, they switch it up to EDM but the crowd remained motionless for the most part. My friend got bottle service and his table was at the front of the club where there is no dancing or view of the DJ booth and light fixtures. Pretty lame. The club caters to the bottle service customers but even so, they do a poor job. So I also made the mistake of leaving the club before I intended - I assumed I could get back in because I had a stamp on my wrist. Nope, the stamp on your wrist just means that you paid to get in. Fantastic.   Would not recommend.

gjQ00L18PvAV450ZOfqYng.review_text: figured we would stop by Origin and grab a bottle the day after 4th of July..   Newer spot in the city, hadnt been there before. Parking was a breeze and theres a safeway a few blocks down the street for that prefade madness. Inside the decor is beautifully set, the chairs were comfortable and the hostesses were super cute and friendly.  cant review the drink prices or strength, our bottles of goose got it loose though!  the crowd reminded me of my middle school days when I used to play Dynasty Warriors on the playstation. I felt like we were partying in asia all over again. not complaining, im 5"11 so i felt uber tall but it was both literally and legitimately an asian invasion haha  I was super faded, they probably already added gratuity into our tab but when I signed for it I may have added additional. our hostess earned it, she was the sweetest!

h47LFVk-RzMJGqzcRgwHOg.review_text: Thank you for making me feel what it is like to be a hot mess again.   Anyways, Origin is located near the Safeway plaza on Webster but don't park in that plaza! You might/will get towed. There's street parking or a garage two blocks down thats $3 bucks an hour. Pretty cheap if you're driving with a lot of friends.  If you go early, the line isn't that long and it's free guest list till 10:30 or else a cover of $20. The interior is nice/chic with comfy couches at the front next to the bar near the entrance.   The drinks are kinda pricey. $14 for an AMF that tastes watered down + $12 shots. But the bartenders are really nice! You should pre-game or go bar-hopping in the Fillmore beforehand if you don't wanna spend a ton of  money on some dranks.  The first two hours played top hip-hop songs and then some good ol' edm bangers like Calvin Harris, Alesso, etc. The crowd is pretty Asian, it was a lot of guys the night I went, they all came outta nowhere. 80% Asian crowd,  I would say. If that's your type, you would be in le heaven.  It gets pretty crowded later through the night that makes it a little harder to walk/dance through the dance floor.   Anyways, I had more fun here than I thought I would. It's not the best club I've been too but it isn't the worst. Go with good friends + good vibes, and it'll be fine lol.

HksMj2RBkQmaDTLaYML3BQ.review_text: Don't let the other negative reviews of long lines deter you. I came here on a Friday night a little after 10, and got inside within 15 minutes just in time for guestlist.  I'm not sure what night other reviewers have gone but I guess it really depends on which night you go. Yes, the bouncers will embarrass you if you try to cut the line even if you step out for a few seconds.  The club itself is small but there's an upstairs so it doesn't get too crazy. I love the lounge area, there's ample seating for you and your friends to chill and sip on your drinks with your pinkys up. The dance floor is remeniscent of The Grand, sort of a circular layout with the the upstairs balcony overview of the crowd.   My not so favorite feature of this club is the tile flooring upstairs for the bottle service area. Extremely slippery especially since spilled drinks and party fouls bound to happen. So all you ladies in those 5 inches heels, be warned!   The crowd is pretty chill, of course mostly asian pursuassion, and plethora of guys. All the single ladies, now put your hands up! And head to origin. :P

6JeTaXe3rtyvoPQP71IbKg.review_text: Newer clubs seem to always have it good.    Origin is well maintained and organized by the owners and curators of The Grand.   The venue itself also hires well seasoned DJ's (just like the Grand)....so yes, EDC is not happening at 10pm when doors open.    Although EDM is properly inserted close to midnight (just when the alcohol kicks in)  Unlike the Grand and it's "two beer option" at the bar, the Origin comes stocked with variety.  Not to mention, their bartenders are also trained   The crowd tends to get a bit asian- if you're not comfortable with that, just a drive up the street is the Marina, home of  tech bros and Lulemon.   There you have it,. Awesome music, awesome crowd.  Check it out, son.

b2DVw6kWq5QdQJRRVS1ayg.review_text: Parking is fairly easy for SF at night on the street for free. We came at 945 and no line, on a Saturday. Coat check: $5/coat.   There are many couches to sit. Not many people did bottle service and they don't kick you out if the bottle service area is empty and you just wanna sit. But god, it's crazily packed because its soooo small. Like at 11 you cannot even dance anymore, it's just going to be standing next to each other. Total of 3 bars.   Music was ok. Didn't impress me. Ratio of girls:guys is almost 1:1. That's pretty good for guys. All asian guys and they do all have the same look.

_fysG2M3W_6UZNkAuqiZ9g.review_text: Your experience will definitely depend on the day you go and the crowd! And I recommend a Friday. On a Saturday, I did not really like the crowd. Disclaimer: I have not been to that many clubs in SF. Def not a club-goer. Yet.  The line and the security: The line can be really long. But if you are coming with your girlfriends, you might get lucky and skip the line! Otherwise, expect to be in the line around 20-30mins? From my experience, the security guys were really chill, friendly and helpful.   The place itself: relatively new, and has a decent size dance floor (but it can get really crowded) and  lots of space to just chill with your friends! At the end, there is some foam or confetti falling down as you dance. pretty cool.  The crowd: pretty chill 20 somethings and few in their early 30s? Not too many creepers. I haven't seen any fights inside or outside, so that's good. Also hot girls.  Drinks: pretty pricey as you would expect from SF clubs, but they are pretty strong though. Do pre-game. Downstairs bar can get really crowded, so go to the upstairs one to get your drinks.  Music: I think it was decent. I honestly do not remember what was playing. Too gone, but definitely had fun dancing to their music!  And of course, if you want to avoid the $20 charge, sign up for guestlist and come around 10. If you come before that, it will be really empty obviously. (but on a Friday, the line was really really long around 10:15pm @@)  To the guys who come here: No means no. We are not trying to play hard to get. lol.

jvq8XqWYOYnG075_ZWbjwA.review_text: If you're a girl, you will spend more time waiting in line for the bathroom than on the dance floor. If you're a guy, you will spend more time waiting for the girl who is in the bathroom. Venue is smaller than I expected. Good music tho but please fix the bathroom issue.

FmZTX66c7cEuxqyw_lcYkA.review_text: I'm just going to start off by letting everyone know that this is the WORST FREAKEN CLUB IN SAN FRANCSICO AND THE WHOLE BAY AREA!   STAY AWAY AND GO BACK TO THE OTHER CLUBS YOU THINK THEY ARE CRAP CAUSE THEY WILL BE BETTER....  And here i'll tell you why in a list of many reasons  1) They purposely hold the line so you cannot make guest list (why have it if you're not going to let people in?)  2) They tell you the club is over capacity to keep you out but when you walk in it is not even packed. This is just so they can charge you cover 3) If you are in line and in the front by the door and it's 10:25, don't expect to get in, they will keep you out till 10:30 and you will have to pay $20  4) I went in to pay, they required an ID to use the ATM so you don't sneak in, I paid got my stamp and the guy had no interest in giving me my ID back, instead was just ignoring me the whole time 5) Bottles are over-priced but the thing that gets you even more mad is that you don't have your own space, instead you get a little corner and they rush you to leave the table (i thought bottle service is all night?) so it's open area, 2 hours, a bottle of cheap vodka, $600-$800 and perks of being bugged to leave 6) One male and one female bathroom downstairs  7) This place is owned by the same owners as grand (dying now) and they close the line at like 11:30 so people cant get in anymore whether you are paying or on guestlist, so they send you off to grand to help their other businesss...shady! 8) Security guys are on a power trip, thinking they can anything. They don't let you in, and they DONT LET YOU OUT! When you try to leave ,they put you in a line and let you out one by one. WTF, I want to leave, let me out!  9) Alcohol is pricey but its a club, nothing different.   Anyways,  I want to go on, but because this can go on forever...I will let you decide whether you want to go. This place is a joke. If you read this and you are trying to find another place to go to replace the usual Sloane, Raven, Grand, Temple, etc. I'd suggest going back to your original places, because this is not the place to go to.   Writing this review angers me and ruins my day. I am off to write a better review for better places.   This place is not going to last long.

Wc6zMTQP1JoVZpVOddlAHA.review_text: Feeling those Vegas withdrawals? This place is the cure to all of your turnt up needs.   The newly opened boutique nightclub is a self-proclaimed little sister of The Grand. For those of you who want to skip the long cab ride into the SOMA -- this is the perfect place to get the job done.   First  rule of clubbing -- always get on guestlist and make it in time for it. Otherwise you're stuck paying the ridiculous $20 cover. Get in line early to secure your spot. After you're in -- it's smooth drinking from there on. The venue itself is clean, new and has that Vegas feel. The best thing about this place is the mix of hip-hop and EDM. It's a healthy alternative between full blown EDC and ghetto ass grabbing pervert dancing (aka Sloane) scenes.   Drinks are medium priced ($10) but well worth the alcohol content. There are two bars and tons of bottle service. For now, this place is classy enough for most -- I just hope it doesn't turn into too trashy (as most nightclubs in SF do).

xon12FQ3dQY_xM6NK_2fig.review_text: As the "newest" club in SF I was ready to experience what it was all about! I live in socal, so I'm accustomed to clubs like Create, Metro, Sutra etc.  I went on a somewhat dead night so the bouncer let my girlfriends and I in for free even though we missed the 10:30 guestlist. (my friend bf still had to pay of course, $20 lol)  The venue itself is nice and has the glamorous clubbing factor but much of the space is dedicated to tables (by the entrance and also the entire upper floor), leaving a rather small dance floor.  It would have been fun if it WEREN'T FOR THE CROWD. The amount of creepers were endless and the thirst has never. been. so. real.   I felt so uncomfortable at every angle with guys trying to grab us, dance awkwardly close to us, linger around or hover.  And just as an observation, some guys looked way too old to be clubbing, other guys were really FOB and the rest looked like underage babies. I think i just went on a bad night...it was so bad lol  And several of the girls drank way too much and were really sloppy, flailing their arms everywhere or stumbling.  The music wasn't too impressive either. If i ever go clubbing again, def would rather go to Ruby Skye.

1XMjbZCLHk0BtdZRCvixHQ.review_text: Came here for a friend's birthday on Saturday and I'm not sure if I'd be back.....there's just too many negative aspects to this club as mentioned by other yelpers.  First off......ridiculously long lines. Second.......rude ass bouncers. Third....... $20 cover which you'd most likely have to pay because you won't make the glist. Fourth........ that $20 spent on mediocre EDM/Top 40 shit. Fifth......... even the bathroom line is pretty crazy. etc.............  One thing that was nice though was fast drink service...but other than that, it's all pretty negative.

ZfxqsSShveh-VGV19t7ghw.user_location: North Beach/Telegraph Hill, San Francisco, CA
ZfxqsSShveh-VGV19t7ghw.review_text: I was here yesterday at their opening night hosted by MetroWize.   I loved it. The design was modern/upscale. Drinks were good, standard club prices, and the music was a variety of top hits and edm.  Right when you walk in there's a full bar and a couch area. There is a small hallway that leads you to the dancefloor which is pretty spacious. The bathroom is located in that hallway and its pretty small, so I am expecting a lot of crowding around that area.  I believe there is a second floor, although I did not make it there for various reasons....  Hopefully this club will bring a lot of business to the restaurants around the area! There is a korean place right in front (opens late) , and safeway, panda express and subway are a couple blocks away ( although they close pretty early).  Surrounding area: no parking, but its ok ! no drinking and driving please.  I dont recommend walking past geary and fillmore near the 22 bus stop. It can get pretty dangerous, and if you are thinking about the McDonalds near by... I am telling you now its a terrible idea. The bf walked past a gun shooting the other day.. imagine how it can get at night.

clxuY9ht3KWNtOhslz2MNA.review_text: Bartender hooked me up with a free round of shots. Awesome. Perfect sized club. EDM. Awesome. Just smile and people will be nice to you. Stop complaining. Life is good.

OzyWzkcct7PXgkg4H1tDRQ.review_text: Came here for the first time last night.  Parking garage one block away cost $1 an hour.   That in itself was purely awesome.  Something unheard of in SF. Arrived around 9:50p and wait to get in was 5 minutes and guestlist = free admission.  Hecka awesome.  Ed the bartender gave me a round of free shots when I got to the empty bar. Freaking awesome.  The dance floor was spacious.  Rediculously awesome.  Bathroom line was never long.  Unbelievably awesome.    Crowd was like 95% Asian.  In my opinion, not so awesome.  However, I brought my own white boy to throw in the mix just to diversify the party goers.  A previous review I read said there were a lot of seating.  True,but they are reserved for bottle service only.  Kudos for having fun at this place!

4jPsIgMZT4_Ks5-myaW9Bg.review_text: Disclaimer: This is my first time writing a review for a club!  It probably won't be as nice and flowy as my food reviews, but fragmented like all the half-memories.  Jk, I remember enough to write a legit review.  Tip: Get there early!!!  The line is super long and hardly moves at all.  We got there around 10 and had to pay cover, $20 cash only.   Music: Mostly EDM, none of those super girly pop songs :D  Space: Tiny dance floor, though I've been in more packed discomfort at the Grand before.  There's a pretty cool staircase to an upstairs area, but everyone up there looks like lame spectators when you're on the dance floor.    Ambiance: I am not a fan of their soap bubbles and confetti because the soap sticks to your hair and it makes the confetti stick too, so everyone always ends up looking kind of ridiculous after these showers.  The lighting is good, with lots of strobe lights and color, though sometimes it's a bit too bright (and you know, everyone always looks better in shadowy lighting)  Crowd: Interesting that it's right next to J-town and close to a Panda Express--crowd is very Asian, fairly good-looking, creepers are neither touchy nor tenacious (they go away if you ignore them; no need to run away and bury yourself in your group of friends)  Dranks: It's still very noisy at the bar area, but the drinks are good.  For the high-dose alcohol, I'm sure it was worth whatever it cost.  Conclusion: Not bad!  Recommended if you like Asian people and don't mind brushing off the soap and static-y confetti.

qIDy9zJfCuqxy6A3exPe_w.review_text: Pass.   There is no diversity in crowd, everyone skews pretty young, long lines for the bathroom, you can't dance to the constant EDM music.  I did not like the place beyond spaciousness. Don't think I'll be coming back here.

Rlna6g4jezXFfSvERvSa-Q.review_text: Worst club I have ever been to, save your time and money. All fob Asian crowd, cramped together, with little to no AC. Made the mistake of getting bottle service. The bottle girls did not do anything and took forever when we asked for additional bottles. Go anywhere but here.

GepUW7JMa963ZL9FMdTnyA.review_text: Got kicked out the line at 10:30 cause they were "at capacity." Friends inside said it was dead. #whacksauce

2fN8mN7uUjOw-QqtcgYqXQ.review_text: Drinks: 3 Decor: 4 Service: 3  Came here for a startup party a while back when they had the entire upper level reserved. Line was pretty long, but we managed to get in after waiting about 10 min since we were in a special line.  $20 cover, and the drinks were somewhat pricey (around $13 for a cocktail). Music was largely EDM, and the restroom lines weren't too long. Way too many people on the dance floor though.
